title: Bank Typefaces
content:
An easy one for experts I'm sure

[http://www.centrebusiness.com/RBC%20Logo%20Colour.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140402024659/http:/www.centrebusiness.com/RBC%20Logo%20Colour.jpg)

[http://www.sidneybusiness.com/directory/user\_media/logo/images/114.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140402024659/http:/www.sidneybusiness.com/directory/user_media/logo/images/114.png)

[http://www.newswire.ca/images/companies/cibc.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20140402024659/http:/www.newswire.ca/images/companies/cibc.gif)

Thanks for your help.

Jay
author: Jay Mac

comments.content: The first two are custom logos (Scotiabank very close to Futura with a diff 'S'). The third is a condensed [Palatino](http://web.archive.org/web/20140402024659/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/palatino_std_bold/?sample_text=CIBC&sample_size=74).

The RBC typeface bears some resemblance to [Rotis Semi Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20140402024659/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/rotis_semi_serif_by_adobe_std_65_bold/?sample_text=Royal%20Bank&sample_size=60).

Thanks Stephen

You suggestion lead me to some research and I think that the CIBC logo is actually a condensed Aldus.

What do you think?
